intro: Argomuellera oblanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed argomuellera, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
